alert.note: Alert for Crawford; Lawrence (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 09 at 8:45PM CST until March 18 at 7:12AM CST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following river in Indiana... Illinois... Wabash River .Ongoing flooding will continue along portions of the East Fork White, White, and Wabash Rivers and their tributaries. River stages are rising again due to previous rainfall over the weekend. Minor flooding is largely expected, which primarily impacts river roads, parks, and agricultural land. The crest on the Wabash River is between Lafayette and Covington. The crest on the White River is near Spencer. The crest on the East Fork White River is between Seymour and Rivervale. New precipitation amounts through the weekend will not impact current flooding. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FRIDAY, MARCH 18... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wabash River at Riverton. * WHEN...Until Friday, March 18. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Extensive flooding is in progress. Higher rural roads begin to flood. High water isolates many river cabins. Seep water becomes a problem. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM CST Wednesday /9:00 PM EST Wednesday/ the stage was 18.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:00 PM CST Wednesday /9:00 PM EST Wednesday/ was 18.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 19.4 feet early Saturday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Thursday, March 17. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. The next statement should be issued Thursday morning by around 1100 AM EST /1000 AM CST/.
